St Paul's Cathedral

St Paul's Cathedral is an Anglican cathedral in London [1], which is one of the most well-known and recognisable scenic spots in the world.

It is designed with a baroque design, where the interior has countless exquisite decorations, such as frescoes.

Creators: Diliff
Licence: CC BY-SA 3.0
Source Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:St_Paul%27s_Cathedral_Nave,_London,_UK_-_Diliff.jpg

Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (2004) depicts the Geometric Staircase in the southwest bell tower, representing the staircase leading up to the Divination classroom.

Creators: Mark Fosh
Licence: CC BY-SA 2.0
Source Link: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:St_Pauls_aerial_(cropped).jpg

In 《Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban》:

01:22:21-01:22:27: The staircase structure inside the castle was photographed from an overhead perspective.

Address: St. Paul's Churchyard, London EC4M 8AD, UK
